name: ping
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I ] to make a short, sharp sound: We heard a small stone ping against our window.
[ T ] informal to send an email, text, or other kind of message, especially to someone's mobile phone: Ping me an email. It is a legal requirement to self-isolate after being pinged by the COVID-19 app.
[ T ]
  computing
  specialized to send a message to another computer in a network to check whether your computer is connected to it
[ I ] US (UK pink) When a car engine pings, it makes a high knocking sound because the fuel is not burning correctly.

[ I or T ] informal to send someone an electronic message which they receive on their screen or phone as soon as it is sent: ping sb about sth An intern accidentally pinged a mailing list about the Senator's position on the vote. Excited messages ping from phone to phone, as employees hear the news.
[ T ] to test whether an internet connection is working by using a program to contact an address: We test the performance of the wireless devices by uploading, downloading, and pinging a remote host.
a test to find out whether an internet connection is working by using a program to contact an address: You can configure your Firewall to block incoming pings.
